result.execSummary:
All charges against Payton M Galati in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Payton M Galati is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Payton Galati in court with Attorney Frank Lettenberger. Attorney Samuel Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
State will file a civil complaint for the charge of Disorderly Conduct and requests a dismissal of file 22CM327. Court will dismiss case. Defendant enters guilty plea to the civil complaint and is ordered to pay $100 fine plus costs due in 30 days or set up a payment plan. Minutes filed.

Defendant Payton M Galati in court.  Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger in court for Payton M Galati.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim also present in court. The parties have a tentative agreement. Minutes filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH E.M.H. dob 2-5-1982. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Payton M Galati in court, in custody by video. Andrew Herrmann for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lettenberger for defendant. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
